Only thing I will say is my room 152 has a very dark balcony due to a very large tree right outside and gets no sunlight at all!  However who sits in their rooms when there is…

title: Stay elsewhere!
review: It was more like being at a Butlin's Holiday Camp! Very disappointing stay, although the rooms were good, although we experienced air conditioning & refrigeration problems in ours; after being reported to reception we were promised that the problems would be sorted the day after we arrived. There was a party of German schoolchildren who were noisy, played football in their rooms & moved furniture every night after 1am, who's escorting teachers turned blind eyes. The meals were all self-service, & if coffee was wanted after dinner, we had to buy it from the bar in reception. Serving staff were rude & indolent. The company who arranged our stay will never use this hotel again. Avoid like the plague or stay at your peril! There were other problems, but I don't have room to include…

title: Perfect Location
review: Just returned from a week in Club Hotel La Vela at Lake Garda, Great location for shops, restaurants, buses, ferry's and 5 mins walk to the lake. We had a room in the annex part of the hotel which had just been re-furbished. clean towel's every day. Hotel food was good, great choice of food every meal, wine was included. Staff very helpful. Would stay there again.

title: Could do better!
review: Have recently returned from a wonderful twelve day holiday in Lake Garda and stayed in this hotel. On our arrival our coach party were asked if someone would volunteer to spend their first night in the sister hotel due to over booking, my daughter and her boyfriend were pressured into it. . . They were quite pleased with the room and room given on their return Me and my husband on the other hand were not. Our room on arrival did in no way resemble the photos used in their brochure. . It was old.I dated, had no air con, no safe or fridge (all of which were advertised in their brochure) It then came to our notice others had complained and I followed suit and was moved into a brand new room in an out building The hotel staff were friendly and happy to oblige. The rooms were clean…

title: Great holiday location!
review: Stayed here as a package with Omega Holidays- me 'n my 16yo DD. Great base, had trips out to Verona, Venice and the Dolomites, and spent our other days swimming in the glorious Lake Garda. Food at the hotel was great, staff friendly and helpful, even helping our group out when our late return from Venice meant that we were technically too late for dinner. They waved us in, no problems! Would def go again! :-)

title: Lake Garda trip, August 2013.
review: I stayed with my wife & 11 year old son, the Hotel staff were very friendly & the rooms were kept very clean, & the food on offer in the restaurant was superb! I have no complaints at all about the Hotel La Vela, & would stay there again if I ever visited Italy again.

title: Nice people but missing resources
review: +  Good situation. Located beside a park and shops. Just a road to cross to arrive at the beach.  Nice people in the restaurant, in the rooms and at the reception BUT not sufficient in number to manage everything.  - Worst beds I have ever seen (see pictures)  Old hotel requiring complete overhaul (in particular bedrooms and bathrooms)  Noise in the swimming pool at night every day

title: Lovely place but not quite up to expectations
review: Torbole is a really nice place, in a beautiful setting and the hotel is very well placed for reaching the centre of the town and the lakeside.  However the week we were there it was exceptionally busy,  hosting a  windsurfing and sailing competition and the town was full of cyclists apparently there for the mountain biking but intent on using the lakeside paths.  There's a very "youthful" feel to some of the bars, and although restaurants are good there are not as many as you might expect.  The hotel was also very busy with many coach parties (including ours!) and at times, with the mass catering, it felt a little like Butlins or worse, school dinners.  The food was average, as you would perhaps expect under the circumstances although as other reviewers have said was plentiful…

title: Very Happy Tour Group
review: I have travelled to La Vela twice now, once with my husband and once with a party of 60 students aged 11-18.  Both stays were fantastic.  The rooms were very good, the hotel room for myself and my husband was clean, comfortable and spacious.  The apartments given to the students were perfect, they loved the fact that they had a balcony and two separate rooms, one with a table and chairs. Again they were clean and comfortable.  Air conditioned when it was hot and lovely and warm at the end of October when it snowed. The food was excellent value.  The menu choice in the main restaurant was very good, the pasta was especially nice.  When travelling with the students the hotel catered for them all really well, including vegetarians, vegans and non pork eaters.  All the students…

title: Great base for touring Lake Garda
review: Torbole is a lovely little town on the edge of the more mountainous  North end of Lake Garda. It is not as commercial as the famous locations around the lake, but just as pretty and has a good bus service. The hotel is set back just 150 meters from the Lake beyond the useful shops and petrol garage.   The Hotel serves many coach parties so if you want a small intimate hotel then this is not for you. We were part of a coach party so expected average quality rooms, mass catering, and lots of coming and goings of guests.   Some rooms overlook the central quadrangle, others the pool, others the coach park. Our room was above the dining room which was fine although noise from the pool area could be heard. The rooms were warm, and although had balcony doors onto the balcony, there…

title: A good all round Hotel
review: Just back from a Leger coach holiday called "Scenic Splendour of Lake Garda".  We stayed 4 nights at the La Vela and found it more than adequate in every way. Breakfast was a cold buffet but with plenty of choice.  Evening meals varied from day to day, but were always enjoyable. One evening we had 5 courses, and we were surprised to find a carraff of red wine provided at meals. Our room was a good spacious size with a balcony giving views of the wonderful mountains.  The shower cubicle was a bit small, but otherwise the bathroom was fine. People who complain about this Hotel are in my opinion very fussy and seem to exagerate tiny faults.  We enjoyed our stay.

title: Good Value for Money
review: Myself and partner have stayed at numerous hotels around Lake Garda over the years and considering the money we paid, I think that Club Hotel La Vela offers good value. 4* hotels there may not be to the same standard as 4* hotels in the UK or Spain but then the prices generally reflect that. Last year we paid nearly double to stay at a 4* hotel in Riva and even more a few years ago in Sirmione so just wish that all those people posting negative comments would just consider what they have paid.  The hotel is in a great location, with the lake only a few minutes walk away and some great bars and shops in Torbole and nearby Riva. The breakfast was fine and so was the evening meal. The room we had was nice and the staff were friendly.  If you want luxury then go for one of the more…

title: Not as bad as some reviews suggest
review: This hotel is pretty average, but certainly not as bad as some reviews suggest.  Our room, in a separate block, was very comfortable, well furnished and clean.  The rest of the hotel is slightly tired - for example, the reception area - but it is nevertheless clean.  The food was fairly good - not out of this world, but quite a good choice and plenty to eat.  The waiting staff were excellent and the highlight of our stay.

title: "FAWLTY TOWERS - WHERE'S BASIL?"
review: Recently returned from a 7 night stay at Club hotel la Vela. We thought we had been upgraded to a 4 star offering comfortable furnishings and delicious cuisine. How wrong this was! Grubby entrance mat was the start of things to come. Poorly maintained marked walls and dark corridors. Our room continued this theme. Dodgy TV on table from 1970's with matching chairs and in the bathroom a fan extractor that sounded like a tractor day and night! On the balcony the painwork was tired and the wooden railings not properly maintained and loose. As far the dining room (no sign of Basil yet) the food was bland and unimaginative - frozen vegs and what suspiciously looked like packet soup! Remember this is a 4 star hotel - NOT. Poor service and organisation with not enough sweets on several…

title: Not the best experience
review: Stayed here for one night on a group tour recently. We were mostly marched out of the main hotel around the back to what was like backpackers accommodation. Even though the rooms were roomy and had balconies the building had that grubby feel about it, including the rooms. The bedspreads would have to be at least 50 years old. Just more modern bedspreads and a bit of paint would have made the room more welcoming. If you are looking for 3 or 4 star accommodation careful booking this hotel. Make sure you get in the main part of the hotel not the detached buildings. Did have a nice evening meal with entertainment and breakfast was sufficient.

title: Italian Dream?
review: Just back home from a seven day stay at this hotel. Like one of the other reviewers we thought we were going to Riva Del Garda, Centrale Hotel only to be told on the coach that we would be staying in Torbole. When we arrived we were sent to the Annex. I've never seen anything like it. Butlins was four star compared to it. We complained strongly and four rooms were allocated in the hotel that night and four the next day. The rooms in the hotel were better and the food in the dinging room was acceptable. The staff very helpfull and pleasant in the dining room. I would think twice about using this hotel unless i was given a room in the main building.

title: Time to improve this Hotel
review: We have just returned after spending four days of our touring holiday at this hotel. On arrival it looks just as it claims to be a budget hotel, the lobby, bar and dining room looked smart and presentable, good start. The lift opened to reveal a very grubby floor carpet, ok so its a lift. On arrival on the first floor we were greeted by a stained carpet lining the corridors, partially covered with some very old and disheveld runners placed at strange angles, trip hazards to everyone else. The decor of the corridors was dated, dirty in places with scuffs and kick marks at various points, also some seats/futons were placed strategically in some corners, obviously fire regulations are different over there, glad we are on 1st floor. The room was the same as the corridor, dated,…

title: STAY AWAY
review: Having done many trips to Italy, I can honestly say this is the worst hotel by a long way I have ever stayed at, Anywhere. Reception staff helpful as much as possible, but our party had many grievances. My room had blood on walls by light switches, filthy walls, bedding felt damp although clean. Shower head sprayed everywhere bar on me!! Food- breakfast downstairs was simply unacceptable, no room to fully cater for everyone. Evening meals were at best, poor! Bar area is ridiculous, too small, no comfortable chairs, and 1 guy trying to serve everyone. Simply put, I have put a letter of complaint in to the holiday company, and will be seeking compensation. 4 star hotel rating,1 star reality. Just remember that Italian hotels Buy their stars, not earned!

title: Second visit to Hotel and would come again
review: Our second holiday to La Vela and we loved it again.  The staff are excellent, very friendly and very helpful.  We needed urgent assistance one day and the staff helped immediately,, thank you. The food is excellent, and the gala dinner is amazing.  We booked through Travel Zoo and Inghams and got a very good deal. The only concern this year was that children were in the pool late at night, some nights even adults.

title: Great Holiday
review: This hotel has been used for over 20 years by the tour company with whom we travelled. The rooms in which we were accommodated were spacious and clean. The buffet food for breakfast was plentiful and there was a number of choices for the evening dinner. The service was good and the staff happy and cheerful and always ready to assist. The pool and surrounding area was kept spotlessly clean. The hotel is well situated both to shops and the lake. Will definitely be returning.

title: Very disappointing Stay
review: Have just reurned from a 6 night stay at this hotel. The hotel was very disappointing. Staff on reception very unhelful.The double room we stayed in was really only suitable for a single person. When we asked could we change we were eventually shown an apparment in the annex which looked as though it hadn't been used in months.Although the room we stayed in was clean and well maintained it was quite dark and gloomy. However the meals were the worst part of our stay. We had booked for vegetarian meals and one night were presented with a starter consisting of slices of meat . The waiter just laughed. The other  meals were so disgusting that we ended up eating out on 2 nights. Not good when you have booked half board. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

title: Not 4 Star - Disappointed but OK!
review: Went with my daughter and her friend (both 17) early August for one week. Upon Arriving at this hotel my first reaction was instant dismay. Mat to entrance of hotel was filthy dirty and never cleaned whilst we stayed there. No lounge area, only tables around very small bar area.  Booked 'Superior' room for 3. Room was ready for us upon arrival, but not what one expects for paying for 'superior'.  This was on first floor (116), so were able to get free Wifi in our room. Shower miniscule, don't think larger people would be able to shower comfortably. Also only two chairs on balcony for a 3 person room. Only view from room was neighbours opposite, also roof from restaurant was adjacent to our balcony, but look above this and you had good view of mountains.  Went to reception and…

title: No complaints
review: We enjoyed staying at this hotel and would recommend it for its location in the heart of Torbole. A supermarket is 50 mtrs away and Lake Garda 100 mtrs.and being just across the road from the main coach park made ideal for site seeing trips. Ice cream and pizza bars were abundant in the surrounding streets.  Breakfast had a good variety and was very tempting. Our evening meal included a 1/2 bottle of wine but mostly the waiters offered more if our glasses were empty. Food was always good and something to look forward to. Gala night was even more so.  The hotel was very clean and gave us a good nights sleep.

title: Disgruntled Scot in Italy
review: Advertise that local cuisine is served, nope - frozen vegetables most nights. Most nights we were served packet soup.  Did have an occassion where we returned from a day trip to find that our room had not been cleaned or made up. When we reported this to the Reception we were informed " every has gone home" "nobody is here to do it". We were provided  with clean towels by the Manger later on, but we had to make the beds up ourselves. Not what we pay holiday money for.  Area was beautiful but would not recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Disappointing food.
review: Very disappointed with the hotel. We were originally meant to stay in Riva at the Hotel Centrale but the holiday company changed us at the last minute. We were assured this was a 4 star but it barely makes 3 in my opinion. Instead of being in the main hotel we were given an appartment in one of the annex buildings. The appartment had a damp smell from the day we came in to it. It was spacious enough and had a good view of the pool from the balcony but the air conditioning was limited in its effectiveness and the shower was tiny. The pool seemed fine but sunbeds were limited in availability. The biggest disappointment was the food. Breakfast was fine offering a reasonable selection each day (including cooked if you wanted it) although the hot food was never very hot. My biggest…

title: No longer a 4 star standard
review: Stayed 1 week early Sept 2011 in "Superior" room which in my view was worse than a Travel lodge. No creature comforts, 2 kitchen chairs & 2 Plastic balcony chairs, fridge, TV and hair dryer. The food was appalling - gave up after 3 days and ate out at far better lower graded hotels,Staff were rushed no variety at breakfast. The hotel brochure was obviously very out of date as there was no guests lounge as shown and no spa as advertised and the culinary description bore no resemblance to the food I experienced. Only redeeming feature was location, but all the hotels in Torbole could boast this as the town was small and very pleasant.

title: Excellent value for money
review: Wonderful hotel with very helpful staff. Gala Dinner was excellent, food, service, atmosphere everything was just perfect.  We stayed in the new complex at the back of the hotel which had amazing views, very large room with balcony. Very clean rooms, clean towels daily.

title: Nice hotel, a bit outdated
review: I have recently stayed here and i really enjoyed it , this small hotel has good facilities , a pool and free Wifi (Bear in mind the Wifi is only available in the bar and restaurant) The food at this hotel was a bit up and down some days it was very good and some days it was not as good, but 2 workers at the hotel stood out, 1 guy at reception was fantastic i do not know his name but he was bald, and had glasses and i'm pretty sure he was German but he was very pleasant and got the job done, also 1 woman in the restaurant called Alisa i think she was Romanian she wears glasses and she creates a good atmosphere in the restaurant and gets things done and makes sure the waiters get things done for the people having a meal, I really liked this hotel but it is outdated, a bit old…

title: Nice hotel shame about the service
review: We where for the second time in Riva, at the same hotel and the first time when we chose Hotel Flora, I went with massive expectations based on other traveller reviews on trip advisor. Our expectations last year 2010 were even exceeded and that’s because of the staff from breakfast: Mirabella and her fiancé, BUT this year me and my husband had the unpleasant surprise to not meet them again and I say this because the difference between that wonderful couple from  last year(where everyone was talking and complimented them on TripAdvisor) and the staff from this year : it’s HUGE. Service at breakfast practically no longer exists, customers are treated as not being presents, you must hurry in the morning at breakfast to get bread ! if something is missing is no longer replaces…. in…

title: Loved This Hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel recently with a group of friends and loved it.  It has a great location just a few minutes walk from the lake.  Also really handy for the bus stop for local buses around the lake and also to Verona. The room was pleasant with a view over the pool. There was a candelit dinner evening with live music one of the nights which was lovely. Breakfast was good so all in all great value for money

title: This is not our usual standard of hotel.
review: We were instructed not to come for our evening meal until 8P.M  We had to sit where  we were told  beside another couple with whom we had little in common for the whole of our stay. The food was O.K. but the service was slow.           We were given a room a long way from reception and had to endure a shower which almost scalded us as there was no instruction on the dial. After our third complaint I was   given the key for another room where I had a proper shower!            The only place to sit was in the bar as there is no lounge.The T.V. only had B.B.C.           world news in  English so not much entertainment.

title: Basic accomodation.  Comfy enough.  Pleasant stay.
review: Rooms:  2 single beds pushed together for a double - this seems fairly standard.  Comfy bed.  Rooms need updating and redecorating to make them nice, but it was OK and got a good nights sleep.  We did not use the aircon (no need at the end of September), so can not comment on it's efficiency / noise etc.  We had a room overlooking the pool and it also overlooked mountains beyond.  Location:  Very pleased with the location.  Couple of minutes walk from the lake, and right next door to the co-op for those holiday essentials (biscuits, crisps, wine etc!).  It is also at the coach point for picking up the coach for day trips.  Faciliites:  Pool - never went in the pool, but we did sunbathe by the side of it on one afternoon.  Everyone who went in the pool shrieked at the coldness. …

title: disappointing birthday trip.
review: went with family last minute with inghams (always ok in the past) to celebrate my 50th birthday ,despite telling inghams the hotel and the rep in the resort there was no acknowledgement made at all.The aicon did not work in two of our three rooms ,reported it on saturday and to rep on sunday,saw rep again on thursday eventually got a fan.Room very tired and smelled ,safe did not work and it was never convenient when we asked to use the hotel one ,they suggested we leave our passports in the pigeon hole,never enough towels,only one in room on arrival.most plug and light fittings were loose, gala night everything had pork in ,but one of us was a vegetarian who was promised omlette or fish ,she got the ham taken off the melon for starter and a plate of cold oily aubergine for…

title: Nice hotel shame about the service
review: Went with a group of 20 adults and 25 kids and had a good time. Location is great near the lake. Weather was hot and AC never worked. Complained 3-4 times but still never worked as with other people in our party. Staff on the whole were pretty good. Room was large and cleaned every day but a bit dated. Shower was the smallest I have ever seen and a tight squeeze to get in. Food was OK which you had to order at breakfast for that evening and had to sit at the same table. Not enough sun beds. The entire party enjoyed their stay and had a good time.

title: Varied experiences
review: We stayed at the Vela as part of a single parents holiday group and had a mixed bag of experiences.  Our room 613 was lovely and very clean with a large balcony overlooking the pool with views of the mountains beyond.  We found the quality of the food to be very good - we were half board - and the variety was excellent with something for even the fussiest child to enjoy. On the down side, we ate our meals in the cellar room which, although decorated well, meant that even on the sunniest and lovliest evenings, we missed out on the atmosphere.  The staff in the restaurant were quite unhelpful in the main and ran the show with an iron fist - we had to sit at the same tables each time, we had to select our evening food in the morning and they were unprepared to rearrange the tables…

title: never a four star
review: Booked a last minute holiday with Inghams to stay at the La Vela Torbole on Lake Garda. The hotel is well situated but the rooms are dated and some guests complained that their rooms smelled. Our room had fridge but others did not. I reported the shower cubicle door was broken but five days later it had still not be fixed.The food is awful we were there on a half board basis but ate out every night. The breakfast was always scrambled egg and bacon, not a great deal of choice. Sometimes they ran out of food. The hotel staff were unhelpfull their command of the english language was very poor, it should be better if being used by english holiday firms. On the plus side the Inghams staff were excellent.

title: Great position excellent value for money hotel
review: We booked thru travelzoo which directed us to Inghams,after reading the reviews re Inghams guests we were pleasantly surprised that we were allocated a table in the upstairs restaurant as were other Inghams guests.It would appear that the downstairs restaurant was used for groups staying one or two nights.The food was of excellent quality with very good choices every day,lots of local fish on the menu.The rooms were cleaned to a very high standard each day.The only down side was the air con broke down for two nights in the middle of a heatwave 37 c at 5 oclock in the evening,but it didn't spoil the holiday.Air con and safety deposit boxes were free to use. The travel rep Danniella was excellent and was helpful in every way. We would definately return to this hotel .

title: Good location, poor service
review: Hotel is superbly located - short walking distance from the centre and the beach of Torbole, however far enough from the crowded road around the Garda lake. Rooms are proper quality, but not renowated recently. The swimming pool is compact but nice. The problem we experienced was with the stinking water ropes, which the reception was  unable both to repair or to offer another room. Hence we left the hotel, at least with the advance payment returned without hassle. Another problems - the parking was fully packed, so we had to park in front of the hotel entrance and could not approach the room to unpack and pack the luggage.

title: very pleasant stay
review: Stayed for one week. Room was comfortable if slightly small. Staff very pleasant. Food good. Location very central. My only reservation with the resort were the number of mountain bikers in the area. I would highly recommend the ice cream at the Flora Cafe on the main road to Riva, the best i've ever tasted

title: very good !!!
review: Lovely hotel in a beautiful area. staff very helpful, food was plentyful and good value, room cleaned daily and nicely decorated. definatley would stay again well done Club hotel Vela !!! booked through Inghams

title: A clean, comfortable hotel offering good value
review: This was booked through Inghams as a late deal. The room was clean and recently refurbished.  The bathroom was spacious and the shower excellent. The air conditioning was audible but not a major problem.  The food was better than average with a reasonable choice.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  Overall it was good value and better than other budget priced holidays we have been on.  For Italy which can be expensive I thought we got a good hotel and holiday at a very fair price. Perhaps not a 4 star hotel but certainly a good 3 star.

title: Not to 4 star standards
review: We stayed for a week in this hotel, having booked through Inghams. The Hotel food is of a very poor standard with limited choice. Our room was basic (not up to travel lodge standard) The air conditioning didn't work and the shower tray was cracked. The staff though, are friendly and helpful. There must be better Hotels in the area than this!

title: Good value for money
review: We booked through last minute . com and after reading the reviews were a little worried to what the hotel was like.  On arrival we were taken to a new block at the far end of the hotel.  The rooms were new and we had a lovely balcony looking over to the mountains.  We were allocated the downstairs resturant with the other Inghams guests and that was fine. The last evening we were told we had a table in the upstairs resturant and we were looking forward to that.  Not so good as downstairs. Guests had taken deserts with their starters so there were none left for us.  It was noisy and crowded and the downstairs was much nicer.  A lovely stay and very convienient for buses and the lake.

title: Nice friendly staff. Food could be easily improved.
review: We had a week at La Vela with our young boy (7 months) and the staff were just fantastic.  They made us feel welcome and were very attentive.  We were half board and well thoroughly under impressed by the food.  The breakfast was the same every day (bread roll, meat/cheese slices and a boiled egg, cereals (no cold milk) and some fruits.  Coffee was good however.  The evening meals were more varied, but always over-cooked.  The menu could be improved very easily, with just a few more basic fresh Italian dishes.   Be aware that the pool is not heated.  But overall we had a lovely time and would return to La Vela - not for the food, but for the great service and wonderful staff.

title: Would highly recommend
review: Recently spent a week here in August 2009. Very good location for the town centre without any of the noise food was excellent. We went half board. Included with your meal is wine and whats better if you want some more you can. We found we were having four course dinners on an evening with a buffet salad to start followed by a starter which was usually a soup or pasta dish followed by a meat or fish dish and a choice of gateau's or mousse to finish. The staff were friendly. The rooms were clean. The only problem was the air con did not work as efficiently as we would have liked and was rather noisy. Plenty of bars within a 10 minute walk. Buses the cheapest way to travel.

title: Not 4*, but fine
review: As with others, booked through internet, hotel allocated on arrival.  Certainly not as bad as it was made out to be.  Staff all really helpful.  Rooms small, no fridge, loud air-con.  Ended up as part of Inghams group - at back of dining room in the basement, didnt object to that, but see why others complained as all other guests either had a bottle of wine and bottle of water with each meal or silver service meals.  Nice range of good fresh food (although one night no vegetarian option available) as other tour companies are served first, Inghams guests didnt always get the full range of dessert options.  We both wanted to drink orange juice, and at 2euros a shot was quite expensive. Used the soap / shampoo and it was not replaced.  When due to leave we checked under around to…

title: Not 4* but absolutely fine
review: My fiance and I stayed at the La Vela for a week at the beginning of August.  We booked it through Lastminute.com and didn't have a lot of information before we went.  Our room was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning worked (although it was a bit noisy).  It had a small fridge which was handy for keeping water and wine cool.  We were also lucky enough to have a balcony overlooking the pool area which was well attended by children during the day and evening.   We didn't swim there but were told the water was pretty cold.   We were on a half board basis and it was the usual continental breakfast with plenty of choice and most mornings an offer of lovely fresh fruit.  Evening meals were fine.  We had to make our choice for dinner at breakfast time which was a bit odd but…

title: Terrific Torbole
review: We have just returned from the Club Hotel La vela and we had a fantastic time, we had previously visited Torbole before when staying in Limone and we assumed that Torbole was a very small resort, but having stayed in Torbole this is by far our favourite part of Lake Garda to date. Now for the Hotel,   This Hotel is certainly not a 4 star in relation to the Pool and the pool area as the block paviours around the pool were uneven and cracked making it dangerous for children and adults.  The  pool was cleaned everyday by the pool man but on closer expection it was dirty around the edges eg scum lines.  The pool water was freezing.   The food at this Hotel was excellent, very fresh and very varied, for people in past reviews to moan about the food was hard to believe as we thought…

title: Would advise caution
review: Just arrived back on the 1st of August. Be prepared if you are in the original hotel (the oldest part) the rooms are very much in need of a refurb. Beds are uncomfortable, had a toilet needing man-handling to stop it running all day and night. Part on order but hadn't been fixed during the week we were there. Shower cubicle very small to move around in and doors kept coming off.  Waiters/bar people very kind including the hotel manager. Customer service from Inghams leaves something to be desired especially in times of crisis.  Main concern is that it has four stars, this hotel should not be sold to UK customers with this rating. We stayed in a four star outside Venice before going to the lakes and there was a vast difference, more in-line with what you would expect.  Pool area…

title: Nice quiet, comfortable and clean...recommend!
review: Pleasant staff and excellent Ingham's reps! Room was small but had pleanty of storage space and fridge (not all rooms have a fridge). The room looked like it had been upgraded recently. We've visited Italy 4 times now (different areas) and have found that all the rooms have tended to be small, the smallest and most expensive was in Venice. This in mind it was a good room . Air con. worked well with no restrictions for use. Food was good with 4 choices for each course. OH!...and sunbeds were NOT reserved at dawn! There seemed to be enough for those who wanted one.  We had a great deal and would certainly recommend this hotel and the beautifull area of Lake Garda!

title: Nice place, good value - to be recommended!
review: Had an enjoyable four day stay at the La Vela. The resort of Torbole is in a lovely location with lots of nice bars and cafes.  Being July, it was very busy (never seen so many cyclists!)  but everyone was well mannered & pleasant - not many English and definitely no "chavs". The hotel was good value - our room was clean, air conditioned with TV, safe & fridge; it was rather small and when the twin beds were put together little space remained. The bathroom facilities were adequate and clean. Being Italy, we were expected to share the dinner table with others in our group; once we had got used to the idea it actually turned out well. Breakfast was standard continental buffet but dinner was a "proper" waiter served meal which we ordered at breakfast; salad was always available…

title: SUPER HOLIDAY!!
review: We had a very nice stay In Club Hotel La vela. The "family rooms" are an execellent choice, because of the extra room, certainly with older children. There even was a good working fridge. The rooms were cleaned every day and  dirty towels replaced.   The airco cooled just enough. Nice balcon with sight on the pool. The water of the pool was rather cool, but some people kept swimming till 10 o 'clock in the evening, so.... We ate all week in the veranda upstairs with airco, a good service and enough variation in the menu's. Also the people at the front desk were very friendly en helpful. Torbole is a very nice place at the Garda lake. We even made a beautiful bike ride (flat/no cars)  along the Sarca river to Arco! Price/quality for Club Hotel La Vela is very good! We surely …

title: Sorry for that exp.
review: Rooms were not clean aircon not working and service far far away from expectations. Lady - Manager should be kept away from the customer service - she just make problems 5 times bigger.

title: Nice & clean, but poor service & food.
review: We paid £299 pp half board and were really pleased to get a 4* hotel for this price, but don't think the hotel warrants the 4* rating. We weren't planning on having a holiday this year, so wanted to keep the trip really cheap, but because of the poor food in the hotel and the expense of travelling in this area we ended up spending £700 in the course of a week. Torbole is lovely, but a little quiet for us. Best restaurants were the Terrace (on the front) and a little wine bar opposite the bank which does really good food and wine (can't remember name). Hotel welcome was pretty poor, no showing to rooms or explanations of dinner times/other info. Room was fine, in a new block so nice and clean and decent bathroom, good air con. Real issue with the hotel was the poor food, we only…

title: superb accomodation
review: just back from this superb hotel,set in the small town of torbole this hotel was everything it promised!.  we arrived at about 9 30 p.m,we had missed dinner,but a cold platter was prepared for us on our arrival,we also had a bottle of wine bought to our table,and i had a glass of beer,drinks were free!!!!!!!. our room was compact,not small,but that suited us,comprised of two singles pushed together,but was ok too. extra pillows were available and so where covers if required,there was a free safe in the room which we used.had a balcony giving stunning views of the mountains. breakfasts were probably our only minor down point,mainly cold meats,rols,boiled eggs,fruit ,etc etc,no english breakfast food im afraid,but you get used to it. dinners were amazing,salad bowl at the…

title: Beautifull
review: We stayed at hotel club la vela in may 2008 an stoped for 1 week. The staff the hotel and the place was very nice, the rooms was very nice an cleaned every day with fresh towels. you had to go down for breakfast every morning to chose what you wonted for evening meal. The food was nice but the best meal was on the gala buffet night it was beautifull. we went half board which was breakfast and evening meal an recommed that you do that as it was quite dear for food. Alex who worked behind the bar was nice an always happy to help. We enjoyed our stay an it was beautifull round the lake, but there wasnt really anything for us to do its really nice for people who like wind surfin.

title: Well, what can I say
review: Arriving at the hotel with a coach party was interesting.  There are pros and cons to this place. Overall acceptable apart from the overbearing manager who was never wrong! The young ladies  on reception  were  super efficient and very  pleasent and helpfull.  The 1  lift couldn't cater for all the people at once and no porter service was on offer. Couldn't swing a cat in the shower and the air con only drops the outside temp by 5% so at 35%outside you have 30% inside! Beds were comfy and rooms kept spotless and fresh linen and towels. You either get a balcony or a fridge if there isn't one. fair do's. Can't complain about noise as there wasn't any apart from by the pool ! Porky pig summed up the menu, which was unfortunate when Italian food would have been welcome on the menu…

title: Great hotel.
review: We have newly returned from a really great priced spring break at this hotel which we saw on teletext - £299/per person for 7 nights half board.  I have to say we were a bit apprehensive, as we couldn't find any reviews.  However, it was absolutely fabulous.  The staff could not do enough for us - after arriving 8 hours late due to flight delays, we arrived at the hotel about nine o'clock in the evening.  The tour rep had asked all the hotels who were expecting guests who had been delayed to provide a cold platter.  This hotel, however, had the full meal waiting for us, including starter buffet, choice of pasta dish, main course and sweet. The food was absolutely delicious for the whole week, and there was plenty of choice.  Cold buffet breakfast and waiter service evening meal.…

title: Great Hotel
review: We have just returned from a week at Club Hotel La Vela. This is a modern hotel with modern rooms, laminate floors, beech furniture etc. We had a standard room with a balcony. The balcony had a mountain view. The room had a fridge and also a safe which was not charged for. We were half board and the service was excellent. The staff were always friendly and couldn't do enough to help. There was a good choice at breakfast and at dinner a choice of 3 starters or main courses including a vegetarian option. The rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard. The pool area and garden area were lovely. The locations is central. The views from the lake are magnificent and I would say the best in Lake Garda. The only downside of this hotel was probaly that you could hear noise from…
